unnormalised: Indian armed forces recognize various ranks & designations. At the apex is the President of India, who serves as the Supreme Commander. Below, the Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), currently Gen. Anil Chauhan, oversees inter-service coordination.
normalised: Indian armed forces recognize various ranks and designations. At the apex is the President of India, who serves as the Supreme Commander. Below, the Chief of Defense Staff (C-D-S), currently General Anil Chauhan, oversees inter-service coordination.

unnormalised: Within the Indian Army, ranks progress from Sepoy to Naik, Havildar, then JCOs like Naib Subedar, Subedar, & Subedar Major. Commissioned officers start as Lieutenants, rising to Captains, Majors, Lt. Colonels, Colonels, Brigadiers, Maj. Generals, Lt. Generals, & finally, the Chief of the Army Staff (COAS), currently Gen. Manoj Pande. Field Marshal is a ceremonial rank, rarely conferred.
normalised: Within the Indian Army, ranks progress from Sepoy to Naik, Havildar, then J-C-Os like Naib Subedar, Subedar, and Subedar Major. Commissioned officers start as Lieutenants, rising to Captains, Majors, Lieutenant Colonels, Colonels, Brigadiers, Major Generals, Lieutenant Generals, and finally, the Chief of the Army Staff (C-O-A-S), currently General Manoj Pande. Field Marshal is a ceremonial rank, rarely conferred.

unnormalised: The Indian Navy mirrors this structure. Ratings begin as Seaman 2nd Class, advancing to Petty Officer, Chief Petty Officer, & Master Chief Petty Officer. Commissioned ranks range from Sub-Lieutenant to Lieutenant, Lt. Commander, Commander, Captain, Commodore, Rear Admiral, Vice Admiral, & the Chief of the Naval Staff (CNS), Adm. R. Hari Kumar.
normalised: The Indian Navy mirrors this structure. Ratings begin as Seaman second Class, advancing to Petty Officer, Chief Petty Officer, and Master Chief Petty Officer. Commissioned ranks range from Sub-Lieutenant to Lieutenant, Lieutenant Commander, Commander, Captain, Commodore, Rear Admiral, Vice Admiral, and the Chief of the Naval Staff (C-N-S), Admiral R. Hari Kumar.

unnormalised: The Indian Air Force follows a similar hierarchy. Airmen rise from Aircraftsman to Corporal, Sergeant, & Warrant Officer. Commissioned officers start as Flying Officers, progressing to Flight Lieutenants, Squadron Leaders, Wing Commanders, Group Captains, Air Commodores, Air Vice Marshals, Air Marshals, & the Chief of the Air Staff (CAS), currently Air Chief Marshal V.R. Chaudhari.
normalised: The Indian Air Force follows a similar hierarchy. Airmen rise from Aircraftsman to Corporal, Sergeant, and Warrant Officer. Commissioned officers start as Flying Officers, progressing to Flight Lieutenants, Squadron Leaders, Wing Commanders, Group Captains, Air Commodores, Air Vice Marshals, Air Marshals, and the Chief of the Air Staff (C-A-S), currently Air Chief Marshal V.R. Chaudhari.

unnormalised: These ranks, while drawing inspiration from global standards, are distinctly Indian in their adaptation and reflect the organizational structure vital for national defense, with designations like Hon. Capt. awarded as a special honor.
normalised: These ranks, while drawing inspiration from global standards, are distinctly Indian in their adaptation and reflect the organizational structure vital for national defense, with designations like Honorable Captain awarded as a special honor.
